paper_abstract: Estimating the presence and size of fishing banks has significant ecological and economic advantages: it contributes to a rational exploitation of the available marine resources, to the reduction of fuel costs, and to a general decrease in required fishing time. This work presents the integration of remote sensing techniques and connectionist models for the prediction of fishing banks. We have developed and implemented an information system that stores and processes the data from various satellites and visualizes them by generating a geographic forecasting map. paper_title: Integration of remote sensing techniques and connectionist models for decision support in fishing catches
